posts.post_content: Over the weekend, from the Goldin Auction I picked up a "Richter's History of Records of Baseball" inscribed in 1914 by Francis Richter to Roy A. Thomas, who was more than a journeyman (in my opinion) center fielder for the Phillies from 1898 through 1911 (with a end of year stint for the Pirates in 1908 and a year with the Boston Doves in 1909), who then coached with Penn, where he had played collegiate ball. The lot included a photo of him in his Penn uniform. I am searching to see if there is a base ball of any type for him. Anyone have one.  Also all suggestions would be appreciated. Thanks!!
He's got an E90-1, Fan Craze, Rose Postcard and E107, along with a W600 Cabinet

[quote name="Griffins" post=1835025]He's got an E90-1, Fan Craze, Rose Postcard and E107, along with a W600 Cabinet[/QUOTE]

Thanks for your help.  Knew this was the right place.  Now I need to find some.
W600, not for sale, but you are welcome to use the image.
There are 3 E90-1's on ebay right now and a Fan Craze.
Thanks.  Sending a note to the sellers

By the way, it will not let me copy/paste the photo.  Printing so far is to small to show detail, and I do not have it from Goldin yet.  Here is a link that shows the photo.  Appears to me to be in his college uniform, pre-dating his stint in the majors.
Duh...never thought of that.  My kids would be embarrassed for me!

TRCo. Roy Thomas - not for sale.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=337289&d=1544747875[/IMG]
Here is an example of his FanCraze card
Terrific Card.  Let me know if you ever want to sell.  Thanks!
